node.title: Water.org UTSC x BTO Winter/Holiday Event

childMarkdownRemark.html: We collaborate with Water.org UTSC to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends, win prizes in games and raffles, and become better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world.
In November 2020, still amid the COVID-19 Pandemic, BTO engaged in a donut distribution initiative while also helping to promote a local small business on campus.
In October, Blankets for T.O. hosted a pumpkin carving contest for UTSC students and giveaway.
BTO held a meet and greet over Zoom at the start of the Fall term to introduce ourselves to the community!
Read about how BTO members distributed blankets in downtown Toronto on a chilly Valentine's Day.
BTO hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community.

content.value: Blankets for T.O. is a non-profit organization situated at the University of Toronto that strives to provide support and resources to those in need within the city of Toronto, as well as raise awareness on the ongoing stigma surrounding homelessness, with the ultimate goal of eradicating it. So far, our team has worked towards our goal by distributing food blankets, and masks to those in need, as well as hand sanitizers due to the ongoing pandemic. We have also interviewed and shared the experiences through our social media presences of those who support the less fortunate, in the hopes of educating others on the severity of homelessness in Toronto, and encouraging them to support the people in their community. Links to our social media can be accessed via the Contact page.
Learn more about what we did last year in 2020 through our year end summary, viewable
